document.title: Fine Arts Standards of Learning Music Middle School Choral

8B43344798834AAC9A981717298D11B1.description:
Apply choreography as a form of expression and
communication (e.g., sign language, riser choreography).

CBD0E1E0285E475EA2982477937D5438.description:
Create movement individually or collaboratively to
interpret a musical composition.

ED74A501F5CA4B27AA07FF3F23B13F4E.description: The student will respond to music with movement.

52DA22B1759147DBA66FD09B1B93CF14.description:
The student will respond to music with movement by
performing choreography associated with various styles of
music.

29C41E5C61004638BB89A59EB0D7B8DC.description:
The student will respond to music with movement by
performing non-choreographed and choreographed
movements.

FB41F4E78D74487FB764B115F58C8B46.description:
Consistently use facial and physical expressions that reflect
the mood and style of the music.

63E7A81FE8E34EB2AD9540A0946D6914.description:
Respond to advanced conducting patterns and interpretive
gestures.

F7B6340F52824E97B0A14003A6288402.description:
Consistently apply dynamic markings while maintaining
correct intonation.

BCDA59C0AC4B423AA66F8BEF39114E8F.description: Perform rhythmic patterns that include eighth-note, half-note, and quarter-note triplets.

A8E56934FF3C4F659A550B34BB8BCDBD.description: Follow and maintain indicated tempos while singing.

BF55B74ECB794688BF1634F8C57D1502.description:
The student will identify and demonstrate expressive qualities
of choral music.

E3D55DF1E59B482C9FE3E841829BF674.description:
Consistently use facial and physical expressions that reflect
the mood and style of the music.

CC7D811F8E9D40F1805E200CD330A1AC.description:
Respond to a wide range of conducting patterns and
interpretative gestures.

3B7561171BD9453184F6334466FBDEB1.description:
Apply dynamic markings (pp, p, mp, mf, f, ff, crescendo,
decrescendo).

A5DED602018D43D2AA9F8B434CB58790.description:
Perform rhythmic patterns that include dotted-half-quarter,
dotted-quarter-eighth, dotted-eighth-sixteenth, and
corresponding rests.

56174FF63E94418093CB7B5C4D12FB9E.description:
Interpret tempo markings (presto, allegro, andante, adagio,
ritardando, accelerando).

CF9D2A3D035B4A52AEA9A6CF62B6FAB2.description:
The student will identify and demonstrate expressive qualities
of choral music.

82DEAAF7AAC6444A88E7D8273506270D.description:
Use facial and physical expressions that reflect the mood
and style of the music.

D392749FDCDE4416BA1332BE745C17CD.description:
Respond to basic conducting patterns and interpretive
gestures.

A8236F82A00E45C9B2C835DCE5ACCE42.description:
Interpret dynamic markings (p, mp, mf, f, crescendo,
decrescendo).

119B461202A9467F9D59B344D41811A3.description:
Perform, from musical scores and rhythmic exercises,
rhythmic patterns that include whole notes, dotted half
notes, half notes, dotted quarter notes, quarter notes,
eighth notes, sixteenth notes, and corresponding rests.

6A0CE8A4C04B4DD1ACF1016BAA57C896.description:
The student will identify and demonstrate expressive qualities
of choral music.

F80D7353E22B4E94B601FEE5D29529BD.description:
Sing music literature with and without instrumental
accompaniment in at least one language other than English.

AF620C1986AF44D79995C5F0D22E6341.description:
Apply proper diction (e.g., pure vowel sounds, diphthongs,
voiced and unvoiced consonants).

125675B95943482B96AAB51F47C77299.description:
Sing an assigned vocal part in music written in three or more
parts.

23EA1CF9E4D049678941111DDD44412A.description:
Blend with other singers on the same vocal part and across
sections using correct intonation.

B764D6CBEB314810A7EF247BB4C8193F.description:
Enhance vocal agility and range by singing developmentally
appropriate vocal exercises, including use of head and chest
voices.

6F4530AB98514EBFA5213A5B71DD2802.description: Integrate principles of vocal health in singing.

31CF4E52CE934F3E974539288FF68B18.description:
Increase breath control through strength and endurance
exercises.

4D4A888CC63248429C3E08417F183F37.description: Identify the effect of physiological changes on the voice.

E0D54EB2B3D14627AF5D3EA333FBA168.description:
Maintain proper posture and breathing techniques that
support vocal production.

B863C0F32DB04CD6BFB765E3A875D209.description: The student will demonstrate vocal techniques and choral skills.

1D72135985774B59BCD16A13DDBCB8B2.description: Sing in at least one language other than English.

2BC6CC4612B94D699EDDFEB88C5D3B1B.description: Sing a cappella and with accompaniment.

parts.

Apply proper diction (e.g., pure vowel sounds, diphthongs,

Notate student-created compositions using standard

A6ADC06403814A559317F37F1DC4EC0C.description: The student will demonstrate music literacy.

C1A1FB2703A243149F82C610F439A4A0.description:
Music Literacy: Acquire the technical skills and
artistic knowledge necessary for
creative, expressive, and artistic
performance.
Demonstrate understanding of
elements of music and ways they
are used for artistic performance
and creative expression

7A7A0E57B04C443FBBA80D504F075B13.description:
The student will demonstrate cross-disciplinary
connections with choral music.

5CBFDA0846FE4D7589B0F305175D8888.description:
The student will examine the relationship of choral music
to the other fine arts.

11437A0FD8724AFF9BA800D24D8E759A.description:
The student will identify the relationship of choral music
to the other fine arts.

90342D037BCF42EC8CA8BCF879775CBE.description:
Cultivate connections to other fine arts and
fields of knowledge. Identify and cultivate connections between
music and other fields of knowledge to
develop problem-solving skills.

433AE9351BB74BB4974A8CC5887DC295.description:
The student will identify and explore ways that new media
is used to create and edit music.

17394BD05756429A85F682F5DC605F01.description:
The student will identify and demonstrate ways in which
new media and technology can influence the
development of music and musical styles.

88C1B95518D2425DBE85FC72BDC090C7.description:
The student will explore ways in which new media and
technology influence the development and performance
of music and musical styles.

29BF3FBA59A24AC1BFE535471D11530C.description:
Understand and explore the impact of
current and emerging technologies. Participate in a rapidly changing world of music
and explore the impact of current and
emerging technologies, media, and processes.

28FD1A8BBA8041B0B572A96520491E8C.description:
The student will investigate connections between music
skills and college, career, and workplace skills.

3926D907D2B34B24A21A529D78397175.description:
The student will compare and contrast career options in
music in relation to career preparation.

ACE2F7DC6D9142D58F801D8E844E06BA.description: The student will examine career options in music.

5CD157D83C6C446D9749049239BD58C9.description:
College, career, and the 21st Century
Workplace. Connect music content and skills to career
options, college opportunities, and the 21st
Century workplace.

B0EC1F5F439A4EA1AE79772D38695759.description:
The student will explain and apply digital citizenship
skills related to intellectual property in music research,
performance, and sharing.

9461BD8B33DE4529B446F0F0DEEA9F8C.description:
The student will identify and apply digital citizenship skills
related to intellectual property in music research,
performance, and sharing.

054DE708728B4BDAA0771D71A6CE2D66.description:
The student will identify ethical standards as applied to
the use of intellectual property.

E504BE1A27084A81AF72F2ABB78B3657.description:
Ethical and legal considerations for music and
intellectual property. Identify and understand ethical and legal
considerations for engaging with music,
resources, and source material as a responsible
citizen.

BA3AB8B9E4B24F3FACEA5934275376B0.description:
The student will investigate opportunities for music
performance and advocacy within the community.

8D7B21E5F20341A4B53BC0DA082E53D9.description:
The student will describe how musicians, consumers of
music, and music advocates impact the community.

B743F4973AD0467DA53F0ED0D09680AA.description:
The student will explore the functions of music, including
the use of music as a form of expression, communication,
ceremony, and entertainment.

737354C1962B4A5982D8F475CB9759C8.description:
Understand music as a form of community
engagement. Identify and interact with music and develop a
lifelong engagement as a performer, supporter,
advocate, and audience member.

E3137F98119B496886CD02BD0DAC1FA7.description:

influences of a variety of musical styles using music
terminology.

58543EC872484A4BB6812C9A56F576A3.description:

27ECD376D0694C6280E798517EBBB221.description:

of music. Demonstrate understanding of cultural and
historical influences of music.

AB4D657230684069BB5E302981F479F8.description:

4E602F3EE35747BBB88F97A49F1A0D3B.description:

971AD6BE026E4FEDACFC5531F0B4C868.description:
